title: Teenage couple who died together in horror crash kissed and said 'I love you' before school every day
text:
Teenage couple who died together in horror crash kissed and said 'I love you' before school every day A relative has said that although they were a young couple, they had definitely found true love Share Gary Kelly and Delia Keary died after a car crash (Photo: Irish Mirror) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A teenage couple who died in a tragic car accident kissed at the school gates every day and said 'I love you' before classes started. 
A relative said they were "meant to go together" after Gary Kelly and Delia Keary's death in Co Limerick, Ireland, last Friday. 
Gary was said to carry a card around with him everywhere, written by Delia, which told him she was the love of his life and that their love grew constantly. 
And mourners at the funeral of Gary, 18, this morning heard he told his girlfriend he loved her before classes started each day, the Irish Mirror reports. Tragic teenage sweethearts Gary Kelly and Delia Keary 
His grandfather, Bobby Stack worked as caretaker at Rice College where Gary and Delia sat their Leaving Certificate last year. 
Addressing mourners at the end of Gary’s funeral mass at St Peter and Paul Cathedral in Ennis, Mr Stack said: “Everyday, Gary would come out first and then Delia would come out and they would have a kiss and he told her he loved her.” 
Gary's love Delia will be laid to rest tomorrow. 
Last Friday, the two teens were on their way to Killarney for a weekend away and died after being involved in a car accident with a truck in Co Limerick. 
Mr Stack said: “Delia was a beautiful girl and was something special. They were meant to go together. 
"I know it is an awful thing to say. Gary loved her so much. For a young lad, Gary put so much love into that woman and she returned it ten fold.” The couple kissed at the school gates every day A Mass card for Gary and Delia at the funeral of Gary Kelly in Ennis on Wednesday (Photo: Irish Mirror) 
Bobby also revealed that after the family received Gary’s clothes back from the emergency services from the fatal crash, they came across a card in Gary’s pocket from Delia. 
Bobby said that Gary - an apprentice electrician - took this card with him everywhere. 
He said that the card reads “To Gary, from the love of your life, Delia, the 23rd of January 2016. To the man I love. 
"I can’t believe I found you. 
"I am always there for you and you are always there for me. 
"No one in the world can make me feel this way and my love for you keeps growing more and more each day.” Read More 
Bobby told the packed congregation: “For a young man and a young woman, they found love. Some people go through this life and do not know love, but my God, this fella knew what love was.” 
Bobby said that Gary and Delia “had something special, they were like an old married couple”. 
He said that the two were couple of the year twice at Rice College and that this "meant an awful lot to them”. Gary Kelly and Delia Keary were said to be madly in love (Photo: Irish Mirror) 
Many of the mourners today were Gary and Delia’s former classmates and were wearing the dark blue school uniform. 
Bobby said that Gary also showed love on a daily basis to his mother, Kim. 
He said: “Every morning before going to work, he always told his mother, Kim, ‘I love you’. We are broken hearted.” 
Mr Stack thanked the emergency services for the work they did. 
He said: “They did an excellent job, but we were just unlucky.” 
In his tribute to Gary, Fr Jerry Carey said that he sat with Gary’s parents, Kim and Shane over the past couple of days and asked them what were Gary’s interests “and the answer I got was ‘Delia, Delia, Delia’. Grandfather Bobby Stack (right) carrying the coffin with family and mourners at the funeral of Gary Kelly in Ennis on Wednesday (Photo: Irish Mirror) 
Fr Carey recalled a story from when Gary didn’t go to school one day and after several phone calls from anxious parents, it emerged that he was in Dublin with Delia because she needed an outfit for the Junior Certificate disco. 
Fr Carey said that the two “are wedded together forever in our memory”. He said: “Whenever you saw one, you saw the other, whenever you heard one, you heard the other.” 
Laminated cards with a photo of the couple on their grad night were made available at the mass with the words ‘Together Forever - Gary and Delia’. Read More Woman set to have legs amputated after being crushed between cars as she got out to inspect damage on motorway 
At the end of the mass, friends sang a song in tribute with the words ‘Say my name like it’s the last time, Live today like it’s your last night. We want to cry but we know it’s alright, ‘Cause I’m with you and you’re with me’. 
Gary was laid to rest at Drumcliffe cemetery in Ennis yesterday and mourners later attended the removal of Delia Keary in Crusheen and her funeral mass will take place today at St Joseph’s Church in Ennis. 
Gary is survived by parents, Shane and Kim and brothers, Dylan and Ross. Like us on Facebook
